com.github.mk23.jmxproxy.jmx

Class ConnectionWorker

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mk23.jmxproxy.jmx.ConnectionWorker

  • public class ConnectionWorker
extends Object

    JMX fetcher and tracker.

    Creates a ScheduledExecutorService to periodically make to a JMXConnector to a JMX endpoint. At every execution, discovers and fetches all remote registered mbeans and populates the local Host object with assicated MBeans and their Attribute. Also maintains the Host access time to allow reaping of unaccessed workers.
    Since:
    2015-05-11
    Version:
    3.2.0
    Author:
    mk23

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionWorker

        public ConnectionWorker(String hostName,
                        long cacheDuration,
                        int historySize)
                 throws MalformedURLException

        Default constructor.

        Initializes the JMXServiceURL to the specified hostName and starts the ScheduledExecutorService for periodically connecting and fetching JMX objects.
        Parameters:
        hostName - host:port String JMX agent target.
        cacheDuration - period in milliseconds for how often to connect to the JMX agent.
        historySize - number of Attributes to keep per MBean History.
        Throws:
        MalformedURLException - if the specified host is not a valid host:port String.

    • Method Detail

      • getHost

        public final Host getHost(ConnectionCredentials testCreds)
                   throws IOException,
                          SecurityException

        Getter for host.

        Fetches the tracked Host object and resets the request access time.

        Parameters:
        testCreds - optional ConnectionCredentials for the provided JMX agent or null if none.
        Returns:
        Host as populated by the most recent fetch operation.
        Throws:
        IOException - if the specified host is unreachable.
        SecurityException - if the specified credentials to the host are incorrect.

      • isExpired

        public final boolean isExpired(long accessDuration)

        Checks expiration of this worker object.

        Checks the last access time against the provided duration limit to determine if this worker is expired and can be purged.
        Parameters:
        accessDuration - time in milliseconds of no access after which this worker is expired.
        Returns:
        true if this worker hasn't been accessed recently, false otherwise.

      • shutdown

        public final void shutdown()

        Stops the scheduled fetcher.

        Signals the ScheduledExecutorService to shutdown for process termination cleanup.
